controllers package

Submodules

controllers.customer_controller module

controllers.customer_controller.charge()[source]

Charge a customer’s wallet.

Request:

JSON object with the amount to charge.

Returns:

The new wallet balance or an error message.

Return type:

Response

controllers.customer_controller.deduct()[source]

Deduct an amount from the customer’s wallet.

Request:

JSON object with the amount to deduct.

Returns:

A success message and the updated wallet balance, or an error message on failure.

Return type:

Response

controllers.customer_controller.delete(username)[source]

Delete a customer by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer to delete.

Returns:

A success message on successful deletion or an error message if the customer is not found.

Return type:

Response

controllers.customer_controller.get_all()[source]

Retrieve all customers.

Returns:

A list of all customers in JSON format.

Return type:

Response

controllers.customer_controller.get_by_username(username)[source]

Retrieve customer details by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer.

Returns:

A JSON object with the customer’s details or an error message if not found.

Return type:

Response

controllers.customer_controller.get_user_from_token_api()[source]

Retrieve user details from a token.

Returns:

A JSON object with the user’s details or an error message on failure.

Return type:

Response

controllers.customer_controller.health_check()[source]

Check the health status of the service.

Returns:

A JSON object with the service health status, database connection status, and uptime.

Return type:

Response

controllers.customer_controller.login()[source]

Authenticate a customer and provide an access token.

Request:

JSON object with username and password.

Returns:

An access token on successful authentication or an error message on failure.

Return type:

Response

controllers.customer_controller.register()[source]

Register a new customer.

Request:

JSON object with customer details.

Returns:

A success message on successful registration or an error message on failure.

Return type:

Response

controllers.customer_controller.update(username)[source]

Update customer details by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer to update.

Returns:

A success message on successful update or an error message on failure.

Return type:

Response
